October 1, 1924.
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
Herewith attached I am sending a copy of the tentative
program for the approaching conference of the National Malaria
Committee to be held in New Orleans, November 24th, and I sincerely
trust you will be able to be present.

It has been the source of joy to me to learn indirectly
of the good health you are enjoying, and to know that you were able
to attend the Jamaica conference.

We shall greatly appreciate your comments and suggestions
with regard to the tentative program and any steps that should be
taken with reference to the National Malaria Committee. You will note
that in naming the Sub-Committees, I attempted as far as practicable
to include men who are giving all, or a considerable part, of their
time to malaria work.

The Public Health Service, as you know, is to have a
Doctor H. R. Carter.
October 1, 1924.
2.
conference of its workers in New Orleans on November 26th and 27th.
Accordingly, we are making an effort to complete the Malaria Committee
work in one day. The program is probably too long, but I am hoping
that some of the reports will be brief, and that by having a time
limit for discussion of the various topics, we can complete the pro-
gram.
With best wishes to you and Miss Carter, I am
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, John A. Ferrell- Doctor H. R. Carter,
2122 California Street, N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
